utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Isn’t this exciting?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s just a weekend, Mother.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad, it’s your first romantic weekend away with Beckett. It’s a big deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, no pressure. And let’s just hope it happens. It’s 4:30 now. If she doesn’t catch a murder by 5 o’clock, we are in the clear.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So, what do you have planned?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – what do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You don’t have a plan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The plan is to do nothing. To relax.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard -

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s not a plan. Women don’t like it when men don’t have a plan. Hey, I’m in college now, I’m living in the world. Plus I read a lot of magazines. Not planning is really bad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay -

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: She’s right. A man says “so what are we gonna do for dinner”, – he’s dead to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. I will make reservations.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Somewhere romantic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And classy. Because Kate Beckett is a classy kind of gal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Under the stars would be nice!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ooh, and you know what else you could do under the stars –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘kay!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: T-minus 1 minute and counting.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing here? You were supposed to wait around the corner so that nobody’d see us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, but I thought it would be fun to be here with you when the clock strikes 5. You know, like New Year’s Eve, except without the kissing, for obvious reasons, - but there will be plenty of that this weekend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can’t you just … shush?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one is going to hear me. Look around you. You are in a room full of detectives and not one of them has a clue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, Castle. Thank you for reminding me that I’m lying to a bunch of people I really care about so I don’t get fired on an ethics violation ‘cause I’m dating you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you can put all that out of your mind in 3 – 2 – 1 … no murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There. Wasn’t that fun?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I will go. And no one will even know I’m –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Castle!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle. What are you doing here, bro?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I … was just on my way to the Hamptons to write … for the weekend when I thought I’d drop by, see if we caught a murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Anything to avoid writing, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, did you hear about Beckett’s weekend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Big plans?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She’s going away with her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A boyfriend? Beckett! Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is the lucky guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: For some reason she’s not telling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, seriously guys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I for one am offended you’re not sharing with us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: After all we’ve been through.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I think we deserve better than that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I have a couple of ideas about what you guys deserve.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon, Beckett! Just give us something. Is he handsome?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, is he handsome?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or is he more of a badass?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, is that it? Is he a bad boy James Dean? Is he a desperado?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m gonna –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me holler at you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would Beckett be holding out on us?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe there’s something wrong with the guy. Maybe he’s bad news.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well then, as her partners it’s our obligation to find out who this guy is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of partners would we be if we didn’t? Her safety could be at stake.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Exactly. And with no active murder case going on, I say we use this time to find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And here we are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my goodness, Castle. Wow. So um, you rich or something?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I’m not James Patterson rich, but I do okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. I’ll show you around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After I finished remodeling the kitchen I swore I was done. But then my designer called, she said I had to tie in the living room so I did that, too. That led to the second floor and the guest bedrooms …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You coming?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is actually my favorite part. The sound of the ocean, complete privacy. Oh, the serenity. The pool is right down here. Most people find it magical. There’s …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s um … … spectacular, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And is that a problem?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s just … I can’t help wondering how many other girls have gotten this tour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Well I’m not going to deny that I’ve brought other women up here. But um … … none of them were you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want to um … go and check out that pool?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sure you will find the temperature suitable but if you would like it any warmer, I can change the temperature, or –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - I could just stop talking. You forgot your suit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somebody’s coming!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Call 911.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ya think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he came stumbling up from the beach … uh .. just after 10:15. Uh, collapsed into the pool. I tried to revive him, but - .

utterance.speaker: CHIEF JOHN BRADY
utterance.content: Were you here as well, ma’am?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Name please?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Katherine Beckett, but do you think we could keep that out of the public record?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: ‘course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not that we’re doing anything wrong, I just –

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Don’t worry. It’s the Hamptons. We’ll be discreet. We’re – we’re not interested in your arrangement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Arrangement?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chief! Chief – uh… I – I don’t – she’s not a –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not a prostitute.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Oh. Sure.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: So, is there anything you’d like to add to Mr. Castle’s statement madam – ma’am?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Only that we didn’t hear any gunshots so that probably means that the killer used a silencer.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Watch a lot of cops shows, do we?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do we know who the victim is yet?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Uh, Randall Franklin. He’s a weekender out here from Manhattan. All we know is that he was at a party up the beach at Douglas Shapiro’s earlier this evening.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY ADAM JONES
utterance.content: Hey Chief! We got him.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY JONES
utterance.content: We got him. Name’s Cassius McMurry. Local meth user. Found him asleep in the tall grass a couple hundred yards to the east with the victim’s wallet. The guy’s out of it. High as a kite.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: That’s unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Meth. These rich kids learned everything these days. Drug arrests? They’ve doubled in the last 6 months. Okay, well, thanks for your help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, what about blood spatter? Did you find any on the beach or on the suspect?

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY JONES
utterance.content: No, but why would I even look? I mean, we got the guy.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sure we will. He had the victim’s wallet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, he could have found that wallet on the beach.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Are you questioning my judgment, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m –

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: We’ve got the guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of cold-blooded killer takes a nap on the beach after shooting someone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m on vacation. If I wanted to investigate a murder, I would have stayed in the city.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A guy died in my backyard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not our case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still, you have to admit as cases go it’s pretty weak.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s still not our case and if you keep obsessing over this it’s going to ruin the weekend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what do we do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe we just try putting it out of our minds, hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but what about the gun? He would’ve had the gun on him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that’s not putting it out of your mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right. I’m sorry. I’m obsessing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I won’t obsess.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except you said it yourself, about not hearing the shots. What kind of meth-head, who obviously doesn’t know what planet he’s on – carries a gun with a silencer? Which by the way, indicates premeditation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not going to get on with our weekend until you’ve gotten some answers, are we?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll get the coffee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, thank you Dougie. And I’m sorry I missed the party. I heard it was killer. Yeah, sorry. Got ya. Okay, last time Shapiro saw Franklin alive was at his party at 8:15.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s 2 hours before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. He was on the beach having an argument with a woman in a white dress. But because it was already dark, Shapiro couldn’t tell who it was. He knew it wasn’t Franklin’s wife because she was still back in the city. Any luck finding a reason why someone wanted Franklin dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, he was a banker at Lehman Brothers and he was involved in an insider trading scandal before they went belly up. Cut a deal for his freedom by testifying against his colleagues.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rachel Rosenberg, Jeff Forshirm, Emily Monroe, Angels Colabro, and Aaron Lerner. Well, they all did time, but now what they’re out any one of them could have wanted revenge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And three of them could have been our mystery woman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to talk to Franklin’s wife. Find out if he hand any enemies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. We just got here. I am not going back to the city.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well fortunately, we don’t have to. I know just who to call.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Beckett’s boyfriend? Don’t you two have something better to do?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, no.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We figure Beckett must have started up with the guy during her suspension.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pretty emotional time for her. Bet she needed a shoulder to lean on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: An ex.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It would explain why she’s too embarrassed to tell us who it is. Makes her look weak.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re thinking the most likely scenario is that it is the last guy that she was with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Doctor Joshua Davidson. It’s him, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, I get that you don’t have a life, Javi, but you’re married Kevin, so what’s your excuse?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Whoever Beckett’s boyfriend is is none of your business.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon, Lanie. You must know who it is. She went back to Josh, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Is this how you interrogate people? ‘cause you ain’t doing nothing but pissing me off. Now I don’t know who it is and I respect Beckett’s privacy, but I do know it’s not Josh because he’s been in the Amazon setting up free clinics for the last year.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think she’s sure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Castle! Yeah, I’m gonna put you on speakerphone so you can weigh in on this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Weigh in on what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll we’re in the morgue with Lanie trying to figure out who Beckett’s boyfriend is.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I have nothing to do with this nonsense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, until you’re bagging their mangled bodies when Beckett finds out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pfft. Like we’re afraid of Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Besides, how she gonna find out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyway, I need your guys’ help. There has been a homicide out here in the Hamptons in my backyard.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Seriously, Castle? What, are you in an episode of “Murder, She Wrote”?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More like Murder, He Wrote. But unfortunately, unlike Jessica Fletcher the local police chief? Not a friend of mine and I think he might have the wrong guy. So, I need you guys to question the victim’s wife in the city. Find out what she knows.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s a pretty big favor to ask, Castle. We’re going to need something in return.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Ferrari.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: For a week.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Each.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? Guys –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But with all due respect to the Hamptons PD, we would like to make absolutely sure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know your husband testified against several colleagues at Lehman. Has he been in contact with any of them?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe one of them came after him for revenge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mrs. Franklin, your husband was seen arguing with a woman on the beach a couple of hours before he was killed. Do you have any idea who it could have been?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was having an affair?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With Natalia Roosevelt. She’s a local. The wife got wind of it; sent him up here to break it off. It’s probably your typical tawdry Hamptons story. Weekender meets local beauty, the elixir to his stressful city life. Whirlwind romance ensues, but then the wife gets wind of it, forces him to end it and that’s when the elixir becomes a poison. With a gun. Only, I’m going to have to work on that last part.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nah, it’s a great story. But how do we prove that it was her he was arguing with on the beach?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, first step is to determine if she was at the party. And there she is. Natalia Roosevelt in the yes column. And ooh. Looking every bit the femme fatale.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, she was a Hamptons town councilwoman and the owner of the Hamptons Sandbar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is a popular local watering hole. Can I buy you a drink?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There she is. Our lady in the white dress. Only now she’s looking dazzling in bright red. So what’s our play?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just keep it light, Castle. Find a natural way of bringing up the murder. See if she reacts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know just what to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I recognize you. You were at Douglas Shapiro’s party last night.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA ROOSEVELT
utterance.content: Ah, who wasn’t?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? But I saw you on the beach. Weren’t you arguing with Randall Franklin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Light, Castle. I said light.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: What are you implying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. No. Only it must be weird for you. You had to be the last person to see him alive.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: Hey uh, Chief?

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: Yeah, Natalia?

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: Come here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: Do you know these guys? Because they are practically accusing me of murder.

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: Castle what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just having a conversation.

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: About Franklin’s murder? Hey, you got a problem with the way I do my job?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now I would never … use those words exactly.

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: Oh? Well how about these words? You and your hooker friend are under arrest for interfering with my murder investigation. Turn around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for the drink.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I cannot believe I let you talk me into getting involved in another department’s murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh like I needed to twist your arm. And at least we know we were right about this guy. . Does he look like he’s got a guilty conscience to you? He’s sleeping like a little baby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, like a baby chainsaw.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY JONES
utterance.content: Castle, Beckett. Chief Brady wants to see you.

utterance.speaker: JONES
utterance.content: Chief.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Hey. Thanks Jones. Hi guys. Want some coffee? It’s fresh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: So I googled you, Miss Beckett. I didn’t realize you were a homicide detective. I’ve never actually worked a homicide before. Other than drug arrests, I deal mostly with folks complaining their neighbor’s dog pooped in their garden. Never even pulled my gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, why are you telling us this?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Because you were right about the meth addict. The lab results came back negative for gunshot residue, which means the killer is still at large. Look, I’m getting a lot of pressure from the Mayor. Rich weekender getting murdered? Not exactly good for business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Still not getting why you’re telling us this.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Okay. I will drop the interference charge if you help out with the investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds good to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah – excuse me for a second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds good? We just spent 2 hours of our vacation in lockup. Isn’t that enough?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, do you really think we’ll be able to relax without getting any answers? Without getting justice?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As long as word doesn’t get back to my precinct that I’m doing this.

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: Works for me. So what do we do next?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get ballistics back?

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: Oh! Yes. Let’s see… bullets pulled from the victim were .30 caliber.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: .30 caliber? Those are pretty rare, aren’t they?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s usually used for hunting small game. Can I see the ME’s report on Franklin’s body?

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: It … has not come in yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then I suggest you pressure the ME to get it back. In the meantime we should interrogate Natalia Roosevelt.

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: Oh, I already spoke to her. She has no motive for killing Franklin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did you ask her about being Franklin’s mistress?

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: No. She didn’t mention that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, suspects tend to hold back on stuff like that. Mmm… flavor country.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: I thought you arrested these guys, John.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Um… that’s –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Chief Brady to you, Ms. Roosevelt. And shouldn’t you be more concerned about the fact that you lied to him about your affair with Randall Franklin.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: I didn’t lie to him. Chief Brady didn’t ask me about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Didn’t Franklin break up with you on the beach last night?

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: So what if he did?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that gives you motive, Ms. Roosevelt.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: Look, I am not denying that I was fighting with Randall. I accused him of using me to get my council vote.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your vote on what?

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: His beloved helipad. He put the thing in his backyard 6 months ago but he needed a variance. We approved it last week. Next thing you know, he dumps me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then he was shot and killed 2 hours later.

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: Two hours later I was back at my bar. Look, the last time I saw him was on that beach. We were still arguing when he got a text and he suddenly ran off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what time was that?

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: About 8:30.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which way did he go?

utterance.speaker: NATALIA
utterance.content: Up the beach.

utterance.speaker: BRODY
utterance.content: Okay then.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I tracked down that text that Franklin got before leaving Ms. Roosevelt on the beach. Couldn’t get the content, but it was sent from a burner phone. Whoever sent it wished to remain anonymous.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe it was about bad business deals. That’s what got him in trouble with his colleagues in the past.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Past does have a funny way of repeating itself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Speaking of which, I have calls in to my sources at robbery to try to link Beckett to her old beau, Detective Demming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Demming? C’mon. Beckett can do so much better. Uh … thank you for the update. I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why are you even helping them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh come on. The good news is they’re completely fooled about us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I don’t understand why they even care.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, why do people care about Brangelina?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so we’re Brangelina now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, no. We’re - – Rickate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, we’re Kate-ick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Caskett. Oh, that’s good! ‘cause of the whole murder thing? Caskett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: So, Natalia Roosevelt has a solid alibi. Three patrons of her bar confirm she was there by 9 o’clock last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Long before Franklin was shot.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: I’ve got Deputy Jones canvassing the houses along the beach in the direction she said Franklin went.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just Deputy Jones?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: It’s the Hamptons. We don’t have a lot of resources. Oh, by the way. I know you wanted to see this. It’s the ME’s report.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Franklin’s lungs were full of saltwater.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning he almost drowned. That’s strange.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: And, based on the condition of the gunshot wounds, he was in the ocean at least 20 minutes after being shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay so … in the ocean for 20 minutes, no one heard the shots being – That’s why no one heard the shots. He was shot off a boat, Godfather style.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the saltwater slowed down his bleeding, giving him enough time to make it to shore.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: So … what? We should try and figure out which boats were in the vicinity at that time?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. So … do we have a witness who we know was on the beach last night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean … someone like our favorite meth addict? McMurry!

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Seriously? The guy was whacked out on meth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that doesn’t that he doesn’t remember what he saw.

utterance.speaker: MCMURRY
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw a boat. About a hundred yards off the beach.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay great. Can you describe it? Maybe its size?

utterance.speaker: MCMURRY
utterance.content: Nah. All I remember is it was being attacked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Attacked?

utterance.speaker: MCMURRY
utterance.content: Yeah. By a shark. A red shark with red eyes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, maybe you are right about him.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Maybe not.

utterance.speaker: MARTY BENTLEY
utterance.content: Yeah I know that boat. It’s just this way. Owned by Aaron Lerner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aaron Lerner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s one of the guys Franklin sent to prison. Do you know if that boat went out last night?

utterance.speaker: BENTLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw it pull away around 9:30.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: That’s an hour after Franklin left Natalia Roosevelt on the beach.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s plenty of time for him to get here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The boat left here by 9:30. Could have easily made it to the water off my house by 9:45.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Red shark.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shark attack.

utterance.speaker: BENTLEY
utterance.content: Oh, watch your step!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BENTLEY
utterance.content: Damn weekend boaters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! Blood spatter. Franklin was shot right there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey Lerner. Killer boat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s the lab report on blood spatter we found on the deck, Mr. Lerner. It’s a match to Mr. Franklin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning, he was shot on your boat.

utterance.speaker: AARON LERNER
utterance.content: No. That’s not possible. He wasn’t even on it.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: How did it get there?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have a witness who saw your boat leaving the marina at 9:30 last night. Where did you go?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: I didn’t take it out last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lerner, c’mon. We know Randall Franklin was guilty of breaking all the same laws you broke but he got off scot free because he ratted you out. It’s understandable that you’d want a little payback.

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: All right, sure. Yeah. I held a grudge. Who wouldn’t? But you know something? I met him on the beach a few months ago and we buried the hatchet. I’ve even had dinner at his house a couple times.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And exactly where were you between 8:30 and 10 last night?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Group. A weight loss group at the rec. What? Look, you want to catch the guy who actually killed him? Check out his neighbor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, his neighbor?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Oh yeah. This guy’s a scary bastard. I’m having dinner at Franklin’s a week ago, right. Neighbor comes over, starts banging on the front door. Now Franklin wouldn’t tell me what it’s about but this guy was threatening him with all kinds of violence.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Okay, thanks. Well, Lerner’s alibi checks out. He was at the weight loss group from 8:30 to 10 o’clock last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meaning someone else took out his boat, killed Franklin, and brought it back without Lerner … learning.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: I’ll have Jones canvass the marina.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meantime, do we know who this neighbor is?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s just a property dispute. They’re a dime a dozen around here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but the way Lerner describes it it sounds like it was something pretty heated.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Well … the neighbor’s a bit of a hot-head, but I’m telling you it is not a motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shouldn’t we at least talk to this guy?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Okay, look. It’s not just any guy. It’s Vincent Cardonno.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vinnie the Scar? Of the Cardonno crime family? That would explain the Godfather style of the boat shooting. I’m friends with his cousin Sal. He’s been trying to get us together for years!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what better time than the present. We could bring him over and ask him what he did last night.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Whoa! Okay, no. I am not going at Cardonno without proof. Look, I gotta run. I gotta go … reroute traffic for the Bridge Hamptons polo semi-finals. But remember, we’ll finish this later. I call the shots! No contacting Vinnie the Scar!

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: Glad we could finally get together, Ricky. Salut. I’m sure Sal told you I’m a big fan of your work. To new friends.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hear hear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie. This meat sauce is to die for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Vinnie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it is excellent. I didn’t know you could cook.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You should pay a little more attention, Castle.

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: See, that’s the difference between Castle and me. You’ve had my complete attention since I’ve been here, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. Watch it, Vinnie. Don’t make me have to do to you what someone did to your neighbor.

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: Oh, you heard about that, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Heard about it? The guy ended up in my pool.

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: Yeah, well you know, I got to admit – I’m not going to shed any tears over that guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh so you knew him, huh?

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: The guy was a real bastard. He builds a helicopter pad in his yard not 50 feet from my house. Every Tuesday ‘round midnight he buzzes right past my bedroom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The balls on that guy!

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: Yeah. So – so I complain. But the town council, they approve it anyway. I know for a fact that guy greased palms. I wanted to kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet. So where were you when you found out about it?

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: I don’t know. What’s it matter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s just the guy you wanted killed ends up killed? How often does that happen?

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: What are you saying, Castle? Hmm? You think I killed the guy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, no … no. Vinnie, no. We’re just talking here. Sit down, have some more wine.

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: No. We’re finished here. And frankly, I am offended that you think I would do such a bush-league hit. If I had whacked that guy, nobody’d ever find the body.

utterance.speaker: VINNIE
utterance.content: Don’t make me wanna do a demonstration.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Makes a valid point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dead bodies, meth-heads, mobsters … is that what you meant by a romantic weekend?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: May I remind you that it was murder that brought us together in the first place. Oh. Hello.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: What did I tell you, Castle? I was crystal clear. I said no contacting Cardonno!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Oh, that was just a friendly meal. Actually, we have some linguini left if you’d like to come over.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: You accused him of murder! And now he thinks I put you up to it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On the bright side, we can rule him out as a suspect.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: He was never a suspect in the first place!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bottom line is, the killer’s still out there.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: No, no. no. No. The bottom line is that after what you just pulled I will find him myself without any more of your help!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, Chief –

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: And if I catch you guys anywhere near this case again I swear I’ll - I will out the two of you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I guess it’s a no on the linguini.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. He uh… said he already ate. Shall we?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I took a closer look at Randall Franklin’s real estate investments. The guy was buying up distressed properties in depressed neighborhoods and turning them into condos.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sounds like smart investments.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but he wasn’t renovating them. He wasn’t leaving them out, nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So he was carrying the mortgage but the buildings weren’t throwing off any income?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And his wife said that the real estate investments were keeping them flush. It doesn’t add up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re right. Has to be something going on in those buildings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only one way to find out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ugh. Franklin definitely didn’t put any money into renovating this dump.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This place is deserted. He’s definitely not making any money here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, so where’s it coming from?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really? You’re checking your text messages right now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s about Beckett, bro. Ah, she’s not with Demming. Morales in robbery says he’s been dating a vice detective for the last four months.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Shh! You hear that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t like this, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, me either.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No way we’re knocking on that door.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, well … the building owner’s dead, the wife is down with us investigating, so –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hands, right now! Move, move, move, move! Move it, move it, move it!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Franklin found a way to monetize his investment after all. Making crank.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. This is definitely a meth lab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Franklin was a meth kingpin, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turns out, all of his properties housed meth labs. Which makes sense, for someone who used to cook the books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why he was killed. It’s a dangerous business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s all about New York now. They boys can take it from here and we can pick up right where we left off before this whole thing came to use.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but why did it come to us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … the universe has a sense of humor, I suppose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. I mean, if this is about meth then why wasn’t he killed in New York?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the killer likes the beach.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I think there’s gotta be more to it, Castle. I mean, they knew about Lerner’s boat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I’m sure the boys will figure it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that requires intimate an knowledge about Franklin’s life. That’s local knowledge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, right, right. Well, maybe the killer just did his homework.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but why would they go to all that trouble? I mean if he was kingpin in New York City, why would they kill him out here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … Unless part of the drug business was out here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains the helicopter. He needed the helicopter to transfer the drugs out here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why he slept with Natalia and greased palms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He needed an approval to get the helipad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it’s much less risky to move your product in helicopter rather than boat or car. No cop is going to pull you over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Chief Brady said that the drug problems doubled over the last 6 months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. When Franklin started using his helicopter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Castle. But I think you should probably –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Call Ryan and Esposito.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Castle was right. His helicopter’s flight plans coincide with when the shipments left the meth labs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm. They also coincide with the late night landings his neighbor was complaining about. So know we know how Franklin was moving his product but it still doesn’t tell us who killed him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well maybe it does. Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: To an FBI buddy of mine to see if Beckett’s back with her old flame Sorenson. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Flight manifest for Tuesday. That includes a guest. Someone else was with him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, I’m on Sorenson. You go get helicopter boy.

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: So I got a ride on Franklin’s helicopter. So what?

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: That doesn’t prove my client was trafficking drugs with him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: True. These do. Signed affidavits from the meth lab workers that you picked up product every Tuesday. You went from making bank to making crank.

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: I didn’t kill Franklin. And – and Chief Brady already confirmed my alibi in the Hamptons.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well maybe you hired someone to kill him. See, I think you never got over your grudge with Franklin. I think you partnered with him, but you always planned to knock him off and take over the business. Am I getting close?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, you’re close. But you’ve just got the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Just last week Franklin was complaining about a local.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A local drug dealer?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Yes. Seems he didn’t appreciate us moving in on his business.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who? Give me a name.

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: I don’t know a name. But Franklin seemed really spooked.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What else did he tell you about him?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: That’s all I know. Everything else I told to Brad and his two consultants.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two consultants?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. The writer, Castle, and his girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Girlfriend? Wha – what do you mean, girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: What does that matter?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey! I’ll ask the questions here, pal. Are you telling me that Richard Castle brought his girlfriend in your interrogation?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was her name?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: I – I don’t remember.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well then describe her. Describe her Lerner, now!

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Okay! Tall! Medium length hair! What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What color? Give me a hair color.

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Uh … uh… brown. Brown eyes, too, I think. Really pretty.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Body type?

utterance.speaker: LERNER
utterance.content: Awesome. I mean, awesome. She was like thin, gorgeous – she was hot. Really hot. Kate! Name was Kate!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Son of a –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You were right, Castle. Franklin was using his helicopter to move meth to the Hamptons. Looks like you blew this case wide open. Looks like you can get back to your writing now, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well there’s still the matter of finding out who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah well, I think Brady knows what he has to do. I already told him to look for a local drug dealer who was feeling squeezed by Franklin’s expanding operation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s a great theory. Nice work.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. But it’s not my theory. Aaron Lerner gave it up when I interrogated him this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aaron Lerner? Aaron – so you interrogated Lerner, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s back in the city. Turns out he was Franklin’s partner in crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. What do you know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You still there, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, still here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … what else did Aaron Lerner say? Did he say anything else about … anything else?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, you know. The usual. “I didn’t do it. You got the wrong guy.” I’m pretty sure he told me everything he knows.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everything, huh? That’s … good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah… Good luck writing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chief Brady, what did I do now?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Nothing. Uh, just wanted to let you know, I talked to Detective Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? So … what did he say?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Well, he got us on to the idea of a local drug dealer. So we talked to McMurry, the meth addict from the beach, and he coughed up the name of the local supplier of meth. Marty Bentley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The marina operator?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that makes sense. I mean, he would know Aaron Lerner’s schedule and when he could take the boat out.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Right. So we got a warrant to search his apartment and found the burner cell phone that sent the text summoning Franklin to the marina.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s great. Congrats.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Thanks. Hey – I couldn’t have done it without the two of you and your resources in New York. Um … I’d be honored if you came to the arrest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … How can we say no?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Police! Down! Get down! Police!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So… Chief Brady’s first time pulling his gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Castle, maybe I should go in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t have a gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that never stops you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’m lucky.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: We got him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Cabin secured.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nice one Chief Brady.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Just like out of one of your books, hey Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, uh – marina owner with side meth business kills competition. Call it … Hamptons Heat. And if I ever write it I’ll be sure to include a gutsy Chief Brady character.

utterance.speaker: MARTY BENTLEY
utterance.content: That’s not mine! Look, I’m telling you. I didn’t do anything. You’ve got the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY JONES
utterance.content: Chief, so far I’ve found baggies of meth and an Automag III 30 Carbine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which shoots .30 caliber bullets just like we pulled out of our victim. That’s our murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: I guess that seals it. Good – good work Deputy.

utterance.speaker: BENTLEY
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. I didn’t kill anybody. You’ve got the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Watch your step.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Officer, hold on a second there.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: What is it, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This knot. Both of these knots. It’s a perfect figure-eight with an underhand, neatly flemished. Did you tie these, Bentley?

utterance.speaker: BENTLEY
utterance.content: Of course I did. It’s my boat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about it, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well it’s beautiful. I mean, it’s perfect. That knot could be in a book of nautical knots.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: What does that have to do with anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everyone agrees that the killer is the same person who stole Aaron Lerner’s boat. That person had to tie the boat to the dock, but that knot was sloppy. I even tripped over it. Whoever tied these figure-eights is an experienced boatman. Tying knots would be their second nature. They’d be incapable of tying a sloppy knot. Bentley can’t be the killer.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: But we found the burner phone that placed the call to Franklin in Bentley’s apartment. How do you explain that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s easy. It was planted. Just like Bentley’s boat here had the meth and the gun. Which I’m sure forensics will show is the actual murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: And just who do you think planted it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you tell me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Chief Brady, who got the information from McMurry on Bentley?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Jones. It was Deputy Jones.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY JONES
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, get back! Everybody stay back.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Take it easy, Jones. We don’t want anybody to get hurt.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY JONES
utterance.content: You rich weekenders. You think you’re so smart. Meantime you pollute our beaches, you throw your money around like you’re better than us!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think I’m better than you!

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY JONES
utterance.content: Oh shut up. I care about that. But then Franklin’s city money wasn’t good enough for him. He had to move in on my side business. So I did what I had to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice! That is a Hamptons Heat twist I did not see coming. But sorry about the whole accusing you of murder stuff. Still buddies?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: So it turns out Jones paid McMurry $500 to point a finger at Bentley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: $500 dollars to ruin a man’s life, huh?

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Well not to sound all Scooby, but he might have gotten away with it if not for you, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’m always glad to help my friends in law enforcement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speaking of which I would like to make a toast. Chief Brady, not everyone could have handled themselves the way you did on the dock today. You’re a good cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chief Brady.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s to you.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: You can rest assured, your secret is safe with me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Shot the bad guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: I should go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: Find a new deputy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was so great to meet you.

utterance.speaker: BRADY
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bye! Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the case in the Hamptons has been solved, but the case of the secret boyfriend remains open. Turns out Beckett’s FBI ex has been stationed in Europe for 6 months.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? You got anything?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah. No, I was just thinking maybe we should drop it. You know, let Beckett’s private life stay private.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, you mean give up? A real detective never gives up on a case, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know it’s not a real case, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re going to tell me what a real case is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, last time I checked it’s when there’s a murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well. There’s been a murder all right. Your spirit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And your dignity, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Well you know what? Just for that, first round’s on you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, good luck with that. Bruce.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bruce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what’s funny? My cover was that I was coming out here to write and I actually got an idea for a book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Hamptons Heat. So you were serious about that, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I already have the story. That’s the hardest part.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, do you have an ending yet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well … I had some ideas, but uh … I’m open to suggestions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How about this? The weekend hadn’t turned out exactly as Detective Heat had imagined, but now nothing - – not even another murder on the beach, could stop her from getting exactly what she desired most.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm… that’s good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can I get a writer’s credit for it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ll talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
